column4: I am trying to install gnome via apt-get on 8.04, and it fails because gnome depends on gnome-keyring-manager, which is apparently unavailable now
How do I get apt-get to recognize the package change?
I have to think there's an easier way to do what you're ultimately wanting to do
*why* are you installing gnome from apt?
because I installed ubuntu from the minimal install CD
oh.  well unless you're interested in wasting a lot of time, I suggest installing from the desktop cd ;)
ah, I've been there mate... can it boot off USB?
it does work, but it's not just like you can conjure up a few packages and have a full Desktop experience
try "sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop" instead then
is there a reasonable way to disable the nvidia thing?
kill it with fire?    um... dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg maybe
there's a command like that, I forgot the exact one
I really don't know, I might joke about chuck norris and the time continuum, but really which bug?
